title: Play Store App Icons not appearing on Home Screen

thread.text:
Hey folks...
Hope everyone had a Good Xmas and New Year...
the title says it all really.. After downloading an app in the Play Store, they appear in my App drawer and are installed and work just fine.. but for some reason.. the app icon itself doesnt appear on the Home Screen..
This isnt the case with my 5T or Pixel 2 XL... Just the XZP...
I cant really pinpoint When it started happening either...
Any ideas or fix anyone?

So you want that feature back? haha Most people want to disable that first thing they do when they get a new phone :P
But, if you want each app you install to also create a shortcut on your Home Screen, then just head over to the Play Store, tap the menu button, go to Settings, and make sure that the 'Add icon to Home Screen' option is active. That should do the trick.

That was the first thing I tried... but that option is not there in "settings" for some reason.. It must be some setting ive clicked somewhere...
Its not that serious tbh, its just something I quite like to have.. but ill get uysed to it.. Im more interested to know what Ive done rather than get it back.. if you know what i mean

There's no "outside the app" setting in some other app that can remove that checkbox. Google may have removed it because so many people turn it off. (Besides, if the current screen is full, the app won't be installed as a shortcut to the homescreen anyway ... on some phones. On others, a new homescreen will be created to make room. [And on a few phones, a new homescreen will be created for each app you install, up to the limit of the launcher.)

It might be a Play Store 'bug' or feature that's being removed... but what's odd is that it's not showing/hiding consistently across devices. We've checked on a few different phones with the same Play Store version, and while I can still see the option on a Note 8, friends with a Pixel can't. 
Apparently if you use Nova you can also set that as an option FOR NOVA, so that would be a good replacement if you have to have it and the Play Store is doing away with the option. But yeah, it seems to be a Google thing.

Much appreciated folks for taking the time... 
I honestly cant find the setting in play store.. and my XZP is the ONLY device that does it, including my 2XL.. which is wierd.. However, Im not worried or concerned about it, because the apps I download work as they should ... I just like to know WHY... is it a bug thatll affect my phone.. 
Maybe because XZP is integrated with Google Now and almost stock Android.. theyve disabled it as you say..
Its a shame because its something I personally liked, but Ill get used to it..
Thanks Anyways

I too like some apps on my home screen. It doesn't appear that one can have a newly installed app automatically go to the home screen too. If there is a way, we have not found it yet.
However, it can be done. Just requires an extra step. Here's how:
Go to your app drawer after installing an app and hold your finger on that app a second or so and an option opens up at the top of the screen that says "Add to home screen." Just drag the app up there and the app gets added to your home screen. Once there, you can rearrange it to your liking.
You will also see that when you hold on an app momentarily in the app drawer, besides opening up the option to add it to the home screen, a box also opens up beside the app for quick access to app info or to uninstal it.

After having used the phone for a week, I noticed today that I have not enabled any of the apps listed on the Device Admin Apps. I came across them when I went into Settings, Lock Screen and Security and then saw the apps in DAA.
The reason I went to Settings was because when I tried to send a text message, the phone prompted me to change the group messaging settings to Group MMS. I was unable to find the appropriate settings to change that in the Messages app settings so I went to the main Settings menu. Now I am wondering if I need to enable at least the Xperia Configurator app to enable me to change the group messaging to Group MMS.
Additionally, should I be enabling all the apps in DAA? 
Help, please.

The main one you should enable is Google's Find My Device, which allows you to remotely lock or wipe the phone in case you lose it. I doubt you need to enable Xperia Configurator to turn on Group MMS. Which messaging app are you using -- the stock one, Android Messages, or some other 3rd party app?

Thank you for your help. I will look into the Find My Device setting.
As for the group messaging issue, I was using the Android Messages app and I think it was the default messaging app as I did not see any other (stock) messaging app on the phone. The settings in the Messages app didn't contain the ability to switch to group messaging. I then went to Best Buy to look at their display model and saw that the display model had the setting in the Messages app to switch to group messaging. This confirmed my research that some phones had that setting in Messages while others did not, the difference apparently attributed to whether the phone was the U.S. version or the international version.
It was suggested to those who had the problem to switch to another messaging app and I did so, switching to Textra. Works fine now. I may check back with Android Messages occasionally to see if updates may bring the group messaging setting to it on my phone. However, I am happy with Textra now so I may just keep it permanently.
Thanks again for your help.

title: [HELP] XZ Premium CAMERA Manual Settings BUG

thread.text: Hello guys - After the Oreo update the phone is acting normal except one bug that happened to the camera - the manual settings are bugged . Im using 4k resolution all the time and full immersive mode all the time too and 47.1.A.12.34 . I tried to clear the camera app, camera common and camera extention data and cache - i cleared the system cache by pressing the power and volume up button till it vibrates 3 times . The settings actually works but a bug which you can see at the screenshot happened - the words AUTO appear on top of the settings icons. I dont want to do a factory reset or software rapair because i wil lose my data . Please guys if you know how help me

Perhaps go back to 1080p.
There really aren't any apps written with 4K in mind.

...are not working, apart from battery/charging.
As I understand it, the notification LED is supposed to light up for various other events. Not happening. All relevant settings are enabled.
Anyone got any clues/tips?

It is hard to find...not intuitive...but here is what you need to do.
Let's pick something...how about messages.
GO to Settings > Apps & notifications > App info > Messages > Notifications > Tap on the actual words themselves "Default Make sound" and another window will open up...notice as you scroll down the toggle to "Always pulse notification light"???? Make sure that is also turned on.
Yes, it is hidden and I am not sure why it is like this but you will have to do the same thing for any and all apps that you want to activate the notification LED.
Of course you need to have the default notification LED turned on for all apps...Settings > Apps & notifications > Configure notifications > toggle on Notification light.
Just remember to tap on the actual words themselves once you are deeper into the individual app settings as listed above for messages. Be aware that some apps have more than one set of words to tap on with an LED toggle in both newly opened windows.
Thanks for that (& apologies for not responding sooner)

I am really pleased with my XZ Premium, however I am disappointed that it does not supply track information when paired to my car stereo. I was hopeful the Oreo update might fix this but upgrade came through yesterday and still have the issue.
Anyone experience similar problem s?

What make, model, and model year is your car? Is the stereo factory installed, or aftermarket? Older systems aren't necessarily compatible with modern Bluetooth metadata. For example, my wife's 2010 Mazda6 has never shown any of that data (even though there are headings for them).

The track, album title, genre data when paired via Bluetooth is displayed fine on my car's stereo from my daughters IPhone 6s, wife's Galaxy S7 and the LG G4 the Sony has replaced. Even my Sony Xperia Z4 tablet. It is an issue specific to the XZ premium which will only display "No Data Supplied"

Fixed the issue.😃
After enabling Developer options under system settings you are able to change the version of AVRCP used by Bluetooth. My phone was set to use AVRCP 1.6 Changing this to version 1.5 immediately resulted in the track data etc displaying correctly on my car stereo display.
NICE. I would never have thought to look there.
